There will be other volumes also presenting Bhavasvamin’s bh─Бс╣гya and the word-index of the sutra-text. The Baudh─Бyana ┼Ъrautas┼лtra belongs to the Kс╣Ыс╣гс╣Зa Yajurveda Taittir├пya recension. It represents the oral lectures delivered by the teacher Baudh─Бyana, hence is the oldest ┼Ыrauta-text. The text is revised here in the light of the variant readings recorded by W. Caland in his first edition (Calcutta 1906), and is presented in a readable form. The mantras forming part of the sutras have been fully rendered into English. The translation is supplied with notes giving reference to the mantras and explanations of the ritual. The work is expected to serve as an advancement of Taittiriya ritualistic studies. рдмреМрдзрд╛рдпрди рд╢реНрд░реМрддрд╕реВрддреНрд░рдореН THE BAUDHAYANA ┼ЪRAUTAS┼кTRA рдХрд▓рд╛рдореВрд▓рд╢рд╛рд╕реНрддреНрд░-рдЧреНрд░рдиреНрдердорд╛рд▓рд╛ KAL─АM┼кLA┼а─АSTRA SERIES рдЗ.рдЧрд╛.рд░рд╛.рдХ.рдХреЗ. рдХ. рдореВ.рд╢рд╛ - рейрео I.G.N.C.A. рдЧреГрд╣реНрдгрд╛рдорд┐ рд╕реБрд░рдердВ рдпреЛ DVAIDHASUTRA (Different views of teachers) CHAPTER - XX DARSA-P┼кRNAM─АSA XX.1 As for the Upavasatha day: how should one ascertain the Upavasatha-day namely, the time on the point of conjunction or in its proximity on the one hand, and when the moon is not visible on the other? Desirable is the point of conjunction, desirable is also the moment in its proximity. To be true, the point of conjunction is in reality the moment in its proximity. People generally take it to be the point itself. Baudh─Бyana indeed says that one should regard that day as the Upavasatha on which, while he is observing the relevant vow, the moon looking like a red ball rises in the east after the sun has set. ┼Ъ─Бl─лki indeed says that the Upavasatha day is thus transgressed. One should find out the moment in the proximity of the point of conjunction or perform the I┼Яti when the moon is full. If, while one is observing the Upavasatha-vow, the moon looking like a red ball rises in the east when the sun has set, he should say, тАЬDo you stop the Agnihotra-rite, and start the rite of the Parvan-day." After that rite is concluded, he should resume the Agnihotra-offering. This is in the case of the Full-moon sacrifice. Now about the New-moon sacrifice. Baudhayana indeed says that one should observe the Upavasatha when the moon is not visible; nor if it becomes visible. One should do so, says Saliki; the Upavasatha falls also on that day when even the moon is visible (at day-break). The moon which becomes smaller and smaller in the course of the preceding nights and appears surrounded by stars at day-break, does not become visible the next day. Therefore one should understand that day as the Upavasatha. As for the adding of fuel to the fires: (the view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of Aupamanyav─лputra. Baudhayana indeed says here that for those who count nine Vihavya rks, one should add fuel to the fires with the Vihavya verses-each one with three verses. For those who count eight, one should repeat the first or the last one. For those who count ten, one should add fuel to each one with three verses, and should recite the tenth standing to the north of the Ahavaniya, ┼Ъ─Бl─лki indeed says here that fuel is added to the G─Бrhapatya once. The Anv─Бh─Бryapacana fire is procured from a secular source. One should therefore add fuel only to the Ahavaniya fire with a Vihavya verse; and should recite the remaining verses while standing towards the north of the Ahavaniya. Aupamanyava says that one should add fuel to the fires with Vihavya verses to each one with a verse; and recite the remaining verses while standing to the north of the Ahavaniya. Maudgalya says that one should add fuel only to the Ahavaniya with the verses, “I receive Agni who 1316 BAUDHAYANA┼ЪRAUTAS┼кTRA рдордпреЛрднреВрд░реНрдп рдЙрджреНрдпрдиреНрддрдорд╛рд░реЛрд╣рддрд┐ twig) : Baudhayana says that one should go to fetch the twig restraining speech and fetch it restraining speech. One should do so, says ┼Ъ─Бliki. One may talk to a br─Бhmaс╣Зa smiling inwardly, not to a non- br─Бhmaс╣Зa. As for the cutting of the twig : Baudh├гyana says that one should cut the twig with iс╣гe tv─Б, and straighten it or gaze at it with urje tv─Б. ┼Ъ─Бl─лki says that he should gaze at it. As for the driving away of calves: Baudh─Бyana says that with v─Бyava stha one should drive away the male calves and with up─Бyava stha the female ones. In the event of the either sex, one should not drop the formula. ┼а─Бl─лki says that one should drive the calves with the combined formula. XX.2 As for the carrying of the twig: Baudh─Бyana says that one should carry along the front of the Ahavan─лya. ┼Ъ─Бl─лki says along the rear of the Garhapatya. This should be the route for carrying the twig in all procedures and also in regard to the milk except the one used in the Pravargya-rite. Aupamanyava says that one should carry the milk in the Pravargya rite along the rear of both the fires. As for the sacrificer’s duties while on journey: Baudhayana says that the sacrificer indeed goes on a journey accompanied by his duties. Wherever he may be, he should go along them mentally. If he comes when the rite is not yet completed, he should follow in recitation the finished part, and join in the remaining part. ┼Ъ─Бl─лki says that one should depute his son or pupil provided he is capable of the performance. If he arrives while the rite is yet incomplete, he should resume his duties at the remaining performance, or he may not pay heed to it. However, both (the son or pupil, and the sacrificer) should consume the sacrificer’s portion. As for the procurement of the sacrificial grass and faggot: (the view expressed in) the sutra is (that of) the two teachers (Baudh─Бyana and ┼Ъ─Бliki). ─А├▒j─лgavi says that one should tie the sacrificial grass and faggot after having offered (rice-balls) to the Pitrs. Aupamanyava says that one should do so next day after the call to the preparer of the oblation-material. As for the heating of the sickle : Baudhayana says that one should heat the sickle or the horse-rib for dispelling the Rakс╣гas. S─Бl─лki says that one should not heat the lustre over lustre. The formulas are intended for the horse-rib. He should (therefore) heat the horse-rib, not the sickle, for dispelling the evil. 3. After evaтЭЮhared the text reads evam ev─Бhariti. This is not clear. Is it wrong repetition? ┼Ъrautakosa Part 1 (English) p. 226 footnote has suggested an emendation evam barhir iti which does not seem imminent. 1320 BAUDHAYANA┼аRAUTAS┼кTRA 1.2: 4.6 рдкрд╢реНрдЪрд╛рддреНрдкреНрд░рд╛рдЮреНрдЪрдореБрдкрдЧреВрд╣рддреАрддрд┐ рее рд╕реВрддреНрд░рдВ рдмреМрдзрд╛рдпрдирд╕реНрдп рее рдкреБрд░рд╕реНрддрд╛рддреН рдкреНрд░рддреНрдпрдЮреНрдЪрдорд┐рддрд┐ рд╢рд╛рд▓реАрдХрд┐рдГ рее [XX.2- XX.3] TRANSLATION 1321 As for the steps: Baudh─Бyana says that after having passed over three or four steps towards the east, one may proceed towards that quarter where he may think he would obtain sacrificial grass. S─Бl─лki says that one should proceed towards the desired quarter from the Ahavaniya itself, but not along the southern door. As for the grasping (of the bunch) : Baudh─Бyana says that one should repeat the formula thrice and repeat the action thrice. Similarly with regard to the tracing around of the hole for the sacrificial post, similarly with regard to the foot-print of the Soma-purchasing cow, similarly with regard to the hole for the Audumbar─л post, similarly with regard to the Uparava holes. ┼Ъ─Бl─лki says that one should recite the formula only once and repeat the action thrice. As for the cutting of the sacrificial grass: (the view expressed in) in the sutra (is that) of Baudh─Бyana. ┼а─Бl─лki says that this formula relates to personal wish. Therefore the touching should merely be oral (not direct). As for the tying up of the Prastara : Baudh─Бyana says that one should fasten it separately. Out of the other grass he should prepare an odd number of bundles. S─Бl─лki says that because Prastara is fastened with a formula, the entire darbha-grass becomes provided with formula. He should not fasten the Prastara separately; the entire bulk should be odd in number. As for the preparation of the cord: the initial twirled bunch should be the fourth (component). So says Baudh─Бyana. The initial twirled bunch should be the third. So ┼Ъ─Бl─лki says As for the piling up of the sacrificial grass: one should first pile up with a formula the bunches other than the one fastened with the (relevant) formula (= the Prastara) and then place upon them with the formula the bunch fastened with the formula. So says Baudh─Бyana. One should first silently pile up the bunches other than the one fastened with the (relevant) formula, and then place upon them with the formula the bunch fastened with the formula. So says ┼Ъ─Бliki. The bunch which was first cut off should also be piled up first. One should first pile up with the relevant formula the bunch which was cut off with the (relevant) formula, then pile up the other bunches silently, turn around (the heap) and fix the loop. XX.3 As for the fixing of the loop: (the view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of Baudh─Бyana. While fixing the loop one should murmur the formula. So says S─Бl─лki. As for inserting (the loop) from west to east: (the view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of Baudh─Бyana. One should insert it from east to west. So ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. says 1322 BAUDHAYANA┼аRAUTAS┼кTRA 1.2: 6.5 рдмрд░реНрд╣рд┐рд╖реЛ рдирд┐рдзрд╛рди рдЗрддрд┐ рее рд╕ рд╣ рд╕реНрдорд╛рд╣ рдмреМрдзрд╛рдпрдирдГ рд╕реНрдкрдпрдВ рд╡рд╛ рд╢рдХрд▓рдВ [XX.3-XX.3] TRANSLATION 1323 As for placing of the sacrificial grass: one should place within the altar the wooden sword or a chip, put (the grass upon it) with the formula and then place it conveniently. So says Baudh─Бyana. Wherever he has to place it, he should place it with the formula. So says ┼Ъ─Бliki. As for the preparation of the enclosing sticks: the middle one should be as high as the breast and the other two as long as the arm. So says Baudhayana. All should be as long as the arm. So says ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. As for the preparation of the faggot: one should prepare (the sticks of) the faggot as many as the Samidhen─л verses. So says Baudh─Бyana. Even more. So says ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. As for the preparation of the Veda: one should prepare it resembling the knee of a calf. So says Baudhayana. Resembling the basket for grains. So says ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. Three-stranded. So says Aupamanyava. With a tip upwards. So says Aupamanyavi- putra. As for the grass for the Pitс╣Ыyaj├▒a : It is with roots because of the general rule concerning Pitryaj├▒a. So says Baudh─Бyana. This (i.e. grass with roots) is found in the Mah─Бpitс╣Ыyaj├▒a alone. (In the Pitryaj├▒a) the grass should be without roots. So says ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. As for the aggregation of Istis: Baudh─Бyana indeed says that in the case of the Istis which are to be performed on the same day one should go out for the cutting of the grass in respect of each of them separately or put it down if already cut separately. One should commence the vow in respect of each Isti separately and at the end of it relinquish it separately. ┼а─Бl─лki says that in the case of the Istis to be performed on the same day, one should go out for the cutting off of the grass in respect of all of them at one and the same time or put it down if already cut (also at one and the same time). One should commence the vow at the beginning of all Istis and release it at the conclusion of all. As for the throwing of the leaves : (the view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of S─Бl─лki. In this connection Baudh─Бyana says that oe should throw one third (of the leaves) on the roof of the fire-hall, one third within the altar and with one third one should agitate the calves. In this way he becomes closer to the cattle. As for the preparation of a fire-stirring stick in connection with the Full-moon sacrifice: One should prepare. So says Baudh─Бyana. One should not prepare. So says ┼Ъ╟Оl─лki. 1324 BAUDHAYANA┼ЪRAUTAS┼кTRA 1.3: 8.3 рджреЛрд╣рдирдкрд╡рд┐рддреНрд░рд╕реНрдп рдХрд░рдг рдЗрддрд┐ рее рд╕ рд╣ рд╕реНрдорд╛рд╣ рдмреМрдзрд╛рдпрдиреЛ рдореВрд▓реЗ рдореВрд▓рд╛рдирд┐ рд╕реНрддреЛрдХрд╛рдиреНрдкрд░рд┐рдирд┐рд╕реНрддрд┐рд╖реНрдареЗрджрд┐рддрд┐ рее рдПрдХреИрдХрд╛рдореЗрд╡рд╛рд╕рд╛ рд╕рд░реНрд╡реЗрдгрд╕рд░реНрд╡реЗрдг рдХрд░реНрдордгрд╛ twig-strainer: Baudhayana says that one should join the roots (of the darbha-blades) to the root (of the twig), form a two-stranded braid (of these darbha-blades), and then tie a knot at the end. In this way the tip of the twig would become united with the darbha-tips. S─Бl─лki says that one should join the roots (of the darbha-blades) to the root of the twig, and (first) form a two-stranded braid, carry the ends of those darbha-blades (again) to the root of the twig, form a three-stranded braid and (finally) tie a knot at the end. In this way the tip of the twig becomes united with the tips of the darbha-tips. XX.4 As for the leaving of the remnant of the Agnihotra-oblation: Baudhayana says that though the sacrificer has chosen clarified butter or grains for his Agnihotra, one should offer milk only on that night and have milk as the remnant of the Agnihotra. ┼Ъ─Бl─лki says that one should not change the oblation until the desire for whose fulfilment it is adopted. If one has chosen clarified butter or grains as the oblation, one should offer it and leave its portion as the remnant of Agnihotra. As for the sprinkling of the utensils to be used for S─Бс╣Бn─Бyya : one should sprinkle them with water sanctified silently. So says Baudh─Бyana. With the water from the water-pot. So says ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. As for the practice that having sat down to the rear of the Garhapatya, one pushes out the embers towards the north by means of the fire-stirring stick : (the view expressed in) the s┼лtra (is that) of ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. Baudh─Бyana says that one should push out the embers silently. This entire formula is intended for baking. As for the placing of the twig-strainer: one should prepare it with the relevant formula and also place it over the vessel with the formula. So says Baudh─Бyana. One ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. should prepare it silently and place over the vessel with the formula. So says One should prepare it with a half of the formula and place over the vessel with the remaining half. So says Aupamanyava. As for following the milch-cows with a formula: Baudhayana says that one should follow each one with the formula, and cause each one to be milked. S─Бl─лki says that one should follow them with the formula recited only once, and cause each one of them to be milked. Aupamanyava says that one should follow them with the formula recited only once and cause them to be milked all at once. As for the following of the drops of milk with a formula: (the view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. The view of Aupamanyava is laid down above. Baudhayana says that one should follow the drops after having coagulaed the milk. For really here is the end of the milk-drops. 1326 BAUDHAYANA┼ЪRAUTAS┼кTRA 1.3: 10.5 рдЙрддреНрддрд░рд╛рд╕рд╛рдВ рджреЛрд╣рди рдЗрддрд┐ рее   1. 4:10.15 рдкрд╛рдгрд┐рд╕рдВрдорд░реНрд╢рди рдЗрддрд┐ рее рдЙрддреНрддрд░реЗрдгрд╛рд╣рд╡рдиреАрдпрдВ рддрд┐рд╖реНрдардиреНрдкрд╛рдгреА рд╕рдВрдореГрд╢реЗрджрд┐рддрд┐ рдмреМрдзрд╛рдпрдирдГ || рдЙрддреНрддрд░реЗрдг рдЧрд╛рд░реНрд╣рдкрддреНрдпрдорд┐рддрд┐ рд╢рд╛рд▓реАрдХрд┐рдГ рее 1.4: 10.16 рдЕрдЧреНрдиреАрдирд╛рдВ рдкрд░рд┐рд╕реНрддрд░рдг рдЗрддрд┐ рее рд╕реВрддреНрд░рдГ рд╢рд╛рд▓реАрдХреЗрдГ рее рдЖрдЦреНрдпрд╛рддрдореМрдкрдордиреНрдпрд╡рд╕реНрдп рее рдЕрддреНрд░реЛ рд╣ рд╕реНрдорд╛рд╣ рдмреМрдзрд╛рдпрдиреЛ рдЧрд╛рд░реНрд╣рдкрддреНрдпрдореЗрд╡рд╛рдЧреНрд░реЗ рдкреБрд░рд╕реНрддрд╛рддреНрдкрд░рд┐рд╕реНрддреГрдгреАрдпрд╛рджрде рджрдХреНрд╖рд┐рдгрддреЛ рд╜рде рдкрд╢реНрдЪрд╛рджрдереЛрддреНрддрд░рдд рдПрд╡рдореЗрд╡рд╛рдиреНрд╡рд╛рд╣рд╛рд░реНрдпрдкрдЪрдирдВ рдкрд░рд┐рд╕реНрддреГрдгреАрдпрд╛рджреЗрд╡рдорд╛рд╣рд╡рдиреАрдпрдорд┐рддрд┐ рее [XX.4 XX.5] TRANSLATION 1327 As for the milking of the remaining cows: Baudhayana says that having released speech and without maintaining the contact, one causes the remaining cows to be milked. K─Бtya says that while the milk is being brought in, one should keep contact and restrain speech. As for one procuring ready milk: Baudh─Бyana says that one should go through the formulas beginning with that for the driving away of the calves. ┼Ъaliki says that one should go through the formulas beginning with that for the pouring in of the milk from the milking pot. As for coagulating : Baudh─Бyana says that one should take up in the fourth spoon that much curds with which he thinks the milk will be coagulated. ┼Ъ─Бl─лki says that one should take up into the third spoon that much curds with which he thinks the milk will be coagulated. As for the injunction that one adds remnants of Agnihotra as curdling agent; (the view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. Baudh─Бyana says that having first poured the remnant of Agnihotra, one should put the curdling agent. In this way both (the milk and the remnant of Agnihotra) become coagulated. As for the injunction that one covers the vessel with a lid containing water: Baudh─Бyana says that having covered the vessel with a lid containing water, one should let it remain the whole night. S─Бl─лki says that having covered the vessel with a lid containing water, one should sprinkle water upon it and (thus) cover. As for the strewing around of the fires : (the view expressed in) the s├╝tra (is that) of the two teachers (Baudh─Бyana and ┼Ъ─Бl─лki). Aupamanyava says that one should strew around the fires in the order of their production. The Br─Бhmaс╣Зa says, “The deities stay with him thinking that offerings will be made to them the next day. One who knowing this strews around the fire ….” As for eating and fasting : Baudh─Бyana says that one shuld consume wild grains and water. ┼Ъ─Бl─лki says that one should only drink water. Aupamanyava says that one should neither consume wild grains nor drink water. XX.5 As for the grasping of the palms: Baudh─Бyana says that one should grasp the palms standing to the north of the Ahavan─лya. ┼Ъ─Бl─лki says that he should do so standing to the north of the G─Бrhapatya. As for the strewing around of the fires: (the view expressed in) the sutra (is) that) of ┼Ъ─Бliki. The view of Aupamanyava is mentioned above. Baudhayana says that one should strew around the G─Бrhapatya first towards the east, then towards the south, then towards the west and then towards the north. One should similarly strew around the Anv─Бh─Бryapacana; similarly the Ahavaniya. 1328 BAUDHAYANA┼ЪRAUTAS┼кTRA 1.4: 12.2 рдкрд╛рддреНрд░рд╛рдгрд╛ рдБ рд╕рд╛рджрди рдЗрддрд┐ рее рд╕реВрддреНрд░ Baudh─Бyana says that one should spread darbha-blades towards the north of the Garhapatya and deposit the implements upon them. R─Бth─лtara says that one should deposit the implements to the north of the fire-chamber, and take them up. as need be. As for the sitting down of the Brahman: Baudh─Бyana says that having passed between the Garhapatya and the Ahavaniya, he should sit down to the south of the Ahavaniha. Without passing between (that is to say, along the front of the Ahavaniya). So ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. says As for the sitting of the sacrificer: Baudh─Бyana says that having passed between the G─Бrhapatya and the Ahavaniya, he should sit down to the south of the Ahavaniya. S─Бl─лki says that without passing between, he should sit to the south of the Ahavaniya. As for the strewing of the Pс╣Ыsthya line: (the view expressed in) the s┼лtra (is that) of Baudh─Бyana. One should strew the Pс╣Ыsthya only in a Soma-sacrifice. So says ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. As for the preparation of the two strainers: (the view expressed in) the s├╝tra (is that) of Baudh─Бyana. Aupamanyava says that one should prepare them out of the darbha-blades from the Pс╣Ыsthy─Б. ┼Ъ─Бl─лki says that one should prepare them out of the other blades which have not been used. As for the injunction that he (the Brahman) restrains speech from the moment of the Praс╣З─лt─Б waters being carried forth upto the call to the preparer of oblation-material : Baudhayana says that he may talk smiling within’ in connection with the ongoing rite. ┼Ъ─Бl─лki says that he may speak only after he has formally released his speech. As for the utterance of the Hotr-formulas: There is a view that one should utter the formulas together with graha-portions and without Sv─Бh─Б-utterance at the end3 There is another view that one should utter formulas without graha-portions and with Sv─Бh─Б-utterances. There is still another view that one should utter them in entirety (that is, together with graha-portion and Sv─Бh─Б-utterance) The former alternative is of Baudhayana; the latter two of ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. As for the utterance of the Dasahotс╣Ыr-formulas; the view of two Acaryas is that having carried forth Praс╣З─лt─Б waters while moving westwards, one should pronounce the Da┼бahotr-formulas. Aupamanyava says that he should do so while taking a handful (of grains).

1331 As for the pouring (of paddy) : (the view expressed in) the s┼лtra (is that) of ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. Baudh─Бyana says that one should pour out paddy from a cart. Having variously touched the yokes, he should step upon the knob of the wheel with the formula, “May Visnu step upon thee.“2 Having gazed at the paddy, he should touch it with the formula, “May the five (fingers) hold thee.“4 One should pour out three times with the formula and once silently for the sacrificers following the practice of taking four portions. Three times with the formula and twice silently for those taking five portions. Katya says that one should take all portions with the formula. XX.6 As for the introduction of taking five portions: Baudh─Бyana says that one should adopt five portions from the pouring out onwards. ┼а─Бl─лki says that one should do so from taking up the portions (of the first cake). Aupamanyava says that one should do so from the offering (of the Ajyabh─Бgas). Aupamanyaviputra says that one should do so from the consuming of four portions (of the southern cake by the priests). As for the putting of the remaining grains : Baudh─Бyana says that one should put them back into the granary or the basket. ┼а─Бl─лki says that he should put them here only (that is, into the poured grains). As for the pouring of clarified butter: (the viewexpressed in) the s├╝tra (is that) of ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. Baudh─Бyana says that after having concluded all rites pertaining to the grains, one should pour out clarified butter. In this way only it would meet the sprinkling together with the oblations. As for entrusting (the oblation-material) : Baudh─Бyana says that one should entrust it to the relevant divinity. ┼Ъ─Бl─лki says that one should say “O Agni, do thou guard the oblation” (irrespective of the various divinities whom the oblations are to be offered). With regard to the milk one should say, тАЬO Viс╣гс╣Зu, do thou guard the oblation.” Vi╚Щnu is the guardian of the milks, Agni of the grains. As for the purification of the sprinkling waters: (the view expressed in) the s├╝tra (is that) of Baudhayana. S─Бl─лki says that while reciting this verse, one should purify thrice. As for the sprinkling of the grains for the cakes : Baudh─Бyana says that one should sprinkle them (three times) uttering the name of each divinity. ┼а─Бl─лki says that one should pronounce the names of divinities one after another and then sprinkle thrice. 2. ┼ЪBr 1.1.2.13 3. 4. As for the respreading of the skin of black antelope: (the view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of the two teachers. Aupamanyava says that one should spread it with its neck towards the east and with the hairy side upwards. As for the crushing (of grains): (the view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of S─Бl─лki. Baudh─Бyana says that one should move the upper crushing stone towards the east with the formula, “For Pr─Б┼Жa thee;тАЭ towards the west with the formula, “For Ap─Гna thee,” and with the formula, “For Vy─Бna thee” one should press crosswise; then he should move it towards the east with the formula, “May I hold thee along an onward rush for the (long) life (of the sacrificer).” He drops the flour on the skin of black antelope with the formula, “May god Savity, golden-handed, receive you. XX.8 J The fire-stirring stick is not to be taken while cooking a single oblation of cooked rice, nor while cooking many of them. So says S─Бl─лki. Baudhayana says that one should take up the fire-stirring stick with the formula, “Thou art fire-stirring stick; do thou grant us food.” He should recite over the Garhapatya the formula, тАЬO Agni, do thou kill the raw-eating Agni.” He should remove a southern ember with “Do thou dispel the flesh-eater.” He should tend the other embers with the formula, “Do thou invite Agni carrying oblation to gods.” He should place over them the vessel for cooking rice with the formula. “Thou art firm; do thou strengthen the earth, strengthen life, strengthen progeny, surround the sacrificer with kinsmen.тАЭ He should surround the vessel with embers by the right with the formula, тАЬThe Rakс╣гas is burnt away, the enemies are burnt away.” He should similarly put all cooking vessels over fire. As for the oblations among which cooked rice is the principal one: Baudh─Бyana says that one should take the fire-stirring stick from the very beginning. He should provide for the portions to be consumed from the principal (oblation i.e. the cooked rice). S─Бl─лki says that the fire-stirring stick is to be taken for the arrangement of the potsherds. One should take up the fire-stirring stick when he is about to arrange the potsherds, and provide for the portions to be consumed from the cake itself. As for the arrangement of the potsherds: (the view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of the two teachers. Aupamanyava says that the potsherds are to be arranged as prescribed in the scripture. One should employ for arranging the first potsherd that formula which is employed for turning the ember, and should turn the ember silently. 1339 and the northern shoulder). Aupamanyava says that one should begin in the east and trace by the right (that is to say, he should draw lines from the southern shoulder to the southern buttock, from the southern buttock to the northern buttock and from the northern buttock to the northern shoulder). As for the levelling (of the altar): (the view expressed in) the s┼лtra (is that) of Baudhayana. S─Бl─лki says that after having levelled up (the altar) with the formula ending with the fourth part (that is, with dha asi… vasv─л c├в’si) one should take up (the wooden sword from the altar) with the fifth (part, that is, with pur─Б kr┼лrasya). As for the placing of the Prokс╣гaс╣З─л-ladle : Baudh─Бyana says that one should place (the ladle) after first having poured down the water from the ladle on the line drawn with the wooden sword. ┼Ъ─Бl─лki says that one should do so without pouring down the water. As for the depositing of the sacrificial grass and faggot: (the view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of Baudh─Бyana. ┼а─Бl─лki says that the faggot should be placed towards the north. XX.10 As for the cuttings of the Veda : Baudh─Бyana says that one should divide the cuttings in five parts and cleanse the ladles. S─Бl─лki says that one should cleanse each of the ladles with all the cuttings and (then) with water. As for the cleansing of the Prasitra-pot: (the view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of Baudh─Бyana. ┼Ъ─Бl─лki says that one should cleanse silently. Aupamanyava says that one need not cleanse. As for the casting away of the cuttings used for cleansing the ladles: (the view expressed in) the s┼лtra (is that) of ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. Baudh─Бyana says that one should sprinkle them with water and cast away on an unfrequented place or on the rubbish-heap. Similarly the cord of the faggot. As for the girding of the sacrificer’s wives: Baudh─Бyana says that one should gird them one by one, make them gaze at the Garhapatya one by one, and cause them to gaze at the clarified butter one by one. ┼а─Бl─лki says that one should gird them all at once, but make them gaze at the Garhapatya one by one, and make them gaze at the clarified butter one by one. Auparnanyava says that one should gird them all at once, make them gaze at the Garhapatya all at once, but make them gaze at the clarified butter one by one. Aupamanyviputra says that one should pass each of them through all actions. As for tying the knot (of the girdle): the view of the two Acaryas is that it should be with the noose downwards and the loose end upwards. Dirghav─Бtsya says that it should be with the noose upwards and the loose end downwards. In this way progeny is born. As for the absence of the sacrificer’s wife: Baudhayana says that the sacrificer himself, seated on the sacrificer’s seat, should pronounce these formulas. are intended for the sacrificer’s wife. Therefore in her absence they need not be heeded. As for the injunction that one makes her (the sacrificer’s wife) gaze at the clarified butter: (the view expressed in) the s┼лtra (is that) of ┼Ъ─Бl─лki : Baudh─Бyana says that one should support it (the vessel of clarified butter) with the formula, “Thou art lustre” after the sacrificer’s wife has gazed at it. Having supported it with a wooden chip, he should carry it with the formula, “Do thou follow the lustre.” Then he should heat it over the Ahavaniya with the formula, “Let Agni not remove thy lustre.” He should carry it, keep it down to the north of the Prokс╣гaс╣З─л-waters and purify. He should purify the Prokс╣гaс╣З─л-waters with the two strainers smeared with clarified butter. As for the gazing at the clarified butter: (the view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of Baudhayana. One should purify the clarified butter after it is gazed, reciting all the formulas together. So says ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. As for the taking up of the portions of clarified butter : Baudh─Бyana says that the Adhvaryu himself should take up (portions of clarified butter) with the formulas prescribed in the Pauroс╕Н─Б┼Ыika Br─Бhmaс╣Зa and also those intended for the sacrificer. The sacrificer should follow the takings with the formulas intended for the sacrificer. ┼Ъ─Бl─лki says that the Adhvaryu himself should take up (portions of clarified butter) with the formulas prescribed in the Pauroс╕Нa┼Ыika Br─Бhmaс╣Зa and also those intended for the sacrificer. The sacrificer should not follow the takings with the formulas intended for the sacrificer. Aupamanyava says that just as the formulas from the Pauroс╕Н─Б┼бika Br─Бhmaс╣Зa do not turn back towards (the sacri- ficer), similarly the formulas prescribed for the sacrificer do not turn back towards (the Adhvaryu). As for the sprinkling of the sacrificial grass and faggot: one should sprinkle ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. each one thrice. So says Baudh─Бyana. Each one once. So says XX.11 As for the sprinkling of the sacrificial grass: (the view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. Baudh─Бyana says that standing, one should sprinkle the tips with the formula, “For heaven thee,” bending, the middle portion with the formula, “For midregion thee,” and sitting down, the bottom with the formula, “For earth thee.” He should sprinkle the knot with the ladle held east to west, and pour down the remaining water from the southern buttock to the northern buttock with the formula, “Do you become energising food for Barhiс╣гad Pitс╣Ыs. Do you go to the earth with your essence.” As for the tossing up of the ladle : Baudh─Бyana says that one should toss it up towards the north in front. ┼а─Бl─лki says that one should do so to one’s rear. The first option is of Baudh─Бyana; the latter of ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. As for the injunction that one hands it (the Prastara) over to the sacrificer or to the Brahman: the first option is of ┼Ъ─Бl─лki; the latter of Baudh─Бyana. As for the spreading of the cord: (the view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of Baudh─Бyana. One should loosen the cord and spread its darbha-blades along the southern border of the altar. As for the spreading of grass within the altar: (the view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of Baudh─Бyana. One should spread from here (i.e. from the west) towards the east bundlewise. So says ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. As for the laying of the enclosing sticks: Baudhayana says that one should put (the end of) the southern enclosing stick upon (the end of the middle enclosing stick) and (the end of) the northern enclosing stick under (the end of the middle enclosing stick). ┼Ъ─Бl─лki says that one should lay them down so that their ends would touch those of the other. As for the injunction that one encloses (the Ahavaniya) by means of the sun : (the view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of Baudhayana. One should pray to the ├Дhavaniya with the formula. So says ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. As for the injunction that one keeps two fire-sticks erect: (the view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of Baudh├вyana. ┼а─Бl─лki says that having kept them erect, he should make them slanting. As for the making of the two separating blades: (the view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of the two teachers. Dakс╣гi┼Ж─Бk─Бra R─Бth─лtara says that the two blades should join the altar in opposite positions (one tip reaching the south, the other reaching the north). Aupamanyava says that they should be taken from the outer part of the darbha-blades from the middle bundle. XX.12 As for the placing of the milking-strainer: Baudhayana says that one should ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. loosen it and put on the Prastara. Without loosening; so says As for the depositing of the ladles: Baudhayana says that one should deposit the Upabhrt as if drawn back a little, and put it under the two blades. ┼а─Бl─лki says that one should arrange them in a line, and should not draw back the Upabhс╣Ыt. As for the taking down of the oblations: Baudh─Бyana says that one should take down along the front of those not taken down and along the rear of those taken down. S─Бl─лki says that one should do so along the rear of those not taken down and along the front of those taken down. [XX.12- XX.13] TRANSLATION 1345 As for the anointing back: Baudhayana says that one should anoint back both- ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. the pots of cooked rice and the potsherds. Only potsherds, says As for the release of the potsherds as prescribed in Adhvaryu’s duties; the two teachers prescribe the release after the taking down of the oblations. Aupamanyava says that one should release the potsherds after the consumption of remnants of oblations. As for the two Agh─Бra-libations: (the view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of Baudh─Бyana. ┼Ъ─Бl─лki says that they should be interlinked like reins.2 As for the call: Baudh─Бyaс╣Зa says that it should begin agn─лd agn─лn. According to ┼Ъ─Бl─лki, agnim agnid. According to Aupamanyava agn─лt paridh─лn┼Ы c─Б’gniс╣Б ca. As for crossing beyond (the altar): when he is going to offer the Agh─Бra- libation, one should cross by the left foot; after having made the offering, he should recross by the right foot. So says Baudh─Бyana. When he is going to offer, one should cross by the right foot; after having offered he should recross by the left. So says ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. As for the call (to the ├Дgnidhra): according to. Baudhayana, it should be O ┼Ыr─Бvaya; according to ┼Ъ─Бl─лki ─Б ┼Ыr─Бvaya; according to Aupamanyava ┼Ыr─Бvaya. As for the choosing (of the Hotr): (the view expressed in) the s┼лtra (is that) of ┼Ъ─Бliki. Baudhayana says that one should strike the wooden sword with its tip upwards upon the rubbish-heap and choose the Pravara. He should then cast away the wooden sword there only and then touch water. As for the choosing of the Hotс╣Ы: Baudh─Бyana says that in case his father or teacher or elder brother is officiating as th Hotс╣Ы, he should utter the name of any of these seniors in a low voice. ┼Ъ─Бliki says that he should utter the Hotr’s name loudly. XX.13 As for the injunctions that one should make the offering advancing each time: Baudh─Бyana says that he should advance in all respects - by steps, by offerings and by pitch. He should offer a bigger and bigger oblation. S─Бl─лki says that advancing by steps, he should make offerings at one and the same place. Aupamanyava says that standing at the same place he should advance in offerings. A├▒jigavi says that standing at the same place, he should make offerings quarterwise by the right and finally into the middle with sv─Бh─Б-utterance.

Caland reads adhvarjave whereas most fo the MSS read ─Бdhvaryavo which seems to be the right reading. The verse y─Бni gharme kap─Бl─Бny is recordced in TS I.1.7.1 which is ─Бdhvaryava. It is again recorded in TS I.5.10.3 which is y─Бjam─Бna. Here the reference is to adhvaryava. The text reads abhisu. cooking of the Anv─Бh─Бrya-rice when the principal offering consists of clarified butter: Baudhayana says that one should cook it. ┼а─Бl─лki says that one should not. As for the placing of the Anv─Бh─Бrya-rice : Baudh─Бyana says that one should place it on the southern buttock (of the altar) having carried it around along the front of the sacrificer and the Brahman. S─Бl─лki says that one should place it (directly) on the southern buttock from here (that is, from the Anv─Бh─Бryapacana fire-place). XX.14 As for the taking away of the Anv─Бh─Бrya-rice: Baudhayana says that one should take it away towards the north along the front of the ladles. ┼а─Бl─лki says towards the north along the rear of the ladles. As for the taking away of the remnants of oblations: Baudh─Бyana says that one should take them away towards the north along the front of the ladles. S─Бl─лki says towards the north along the rear of the ladles. As for the offerings of the An┼лy─Бjas: (the view expressed in) the s┼лtra (is that) of Baudhayana. ┼а─Бl─лki says that one should offer them so as to conclude towards the west. As for the besmearing of the Prastara: Baudh─Бyana says that one should besmear it thrice in each ladle. ┼Ъaliki says that one should do so only once. As for the throwing of the Prastara (on the fire): Baudhayana says that the Adhvaryu himself should throw it with both the kinds of formulas, namely, those from the Pauroс╕Н─Б┼Ыika K─Бс╣Зс╕Нa and the Y─Бjam─Бna K─Бс╣Зс╕Нa. principal priests should consume Brahmaudana. Here itself they are regarded to have undergone the T─Бnunaptra oath. As for the putting of the fire-sticks: (the view expressed in) the s┼лtra (is that) of ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. Baudh─Бhana says that after the priests have eaten once and while they have not touched back the rice, one should besmear the fire-sticks and put them on the fire. Aupamanyava says that one should besmear them and keep by his side. When the entire rice has been consumed, one should cleanse the vessel, spread clarified butter in it, pour into it in one attempt the clarified butter remaining in the vessel, besmear the fire-sticks with it and put them on the fire. As for the offering of a cow: one should offer; so says Baudhayana. One should not; so says ┼Ъaliki. One may offer even many cows; his benevolence will be praised; so says Katya. As for the handing over of the kindling woods: (the view expressed in) the s┼лtra (is that) of the two teachers. Aupamanyava says that one should hand over the kindling woods in the latter part of night. (The sacrificer) should release speech when he says “I give away the boon.” As for the besmearing of the fire-place: (the view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of the two teachers. Aupamanyava says that one should besmear only the Garhapatya fire-place; because it is consumed by fire. As for the pouring down of the substances: (the view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of the two teachers. Aupamanyava says that one should deposit the substances with all formulas in the Garhapatya fire-place and then pour them down in three fire-places. XX.17 As for the lifting of the burning faggot : Baudhayana says that one should first lift as high as the knee, then as high as the navel and then as high as the neck. One should however not lift above the breaths. S─Бl─лki says that while taking up the faggot one should achieve these heights. One should however not lift above the breaths. As for the treading upon the substances: (the view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of S─Бl─лki. Baudhayana says that one should make (the horse) face towards the west and then make it step with his right front hoof upon the northern portion of the substances at a spot to which the glowing coals of the fire after it is deposited, would reach. As for the giving away of the horse: Baudh─Бyana says that one should give away to the Adhvaryu the horse on whose hoof-print the fire is to be deposited, and another to the Brahman. ┼а─Бl─лki says that one should give away this horse to the Brahman and another to the Adhvaryu. As for the depositing of the burning faggot; (the view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of Baudh─Бyana. ┼а─Бl─лki says that one should deposit the faggot silently. 1356 BAUDHAYANASRAUTAS┼кTRA II. 17 Baudh─Бyana. They should be ever-lasting since the setting; so says As for the placing of the implements: (the view expressed in) the s┼лtra (is that) of ┼Ъaliki. Baudh─Бyana says that one should place the implements either on a bunch of darbha-blades or stray darbhas. Wood coming in contact with wood leads to the scarcity of cattle.2 (Therefore one should not place them on a wooden plank). As for the offering of the milk of two cows: Baudh─Бyana says that if the milk of the first cow spills out, one should offer as expiation the milk of the second cow. If the milk of the second cow spills out, both the milks would be defective, so one should offer expiation with the milk of another cow. ┼Ъ─Бl─лki says that whichever of the milks spills out, both would be defective. One should offer expiation with the milk of another cow. XX.20 AGNIHOTRA As for the illumination (of the milk): (the view expressed in) the s┼лtra (is that) of Baudh─Бyana. ┼Ъ─Бl─лki says that one should illuminate with a burning coal from the Garhapatya and then move a fire-brand thrice around. As for the injunction that one takes down the vessel of milk towards the north leaving a track on the ground: (the view expressed in the sutra (is that) of ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. Baudh─Бyana says that one should take it down retaining it thrice at the three places. As for the fillings of the spoon-full or a little less: The former option is of Baudh─Бyana; the latter of ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. As for the touching together (of the milks): Baudh─Бyana says that one should touch together the milk in the vessel and that in the ladle. S─Бl─лki says that one should touch only that in the ladle. As for the injunction that one places the ladle to the rear of the Garhapatya : (the view expressed in) the s┼лtra (is that) of Baudh─Бyana. ┼а─Бl─лki says that one should keep it down carrying along the front. As for offering of the milk: Baudh─Бyana says that one should oneself crossover and make the offering. ┼Ъ─Бl─лki says that if one’s son or disciple is capable, he, seated towards the south, should make the offering. As for the offering of two oblations : One should offer east and west; so says Baudh─Бyana. In a line, so says S─Бliki. Having wiped off (the ladle) twice, one should twice apply the wipings to the darbha-blades, so says Baudh─Бyana. One should wipe off once and apply the ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. wipings twice to the darbha-blades; so says As for the injunction that having consumed the remnants of the Agnihotra and having turned towards the north, one consumes the remnants of the ladle held 2. apasavyam is found in the MSS. One should consume the remnants of the ladle held with its handle towards the north. So says ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. As for the injunction that one should rinse the ladle, heat it, fill in with water and toss upwards towards the north. (This means that one) pours down water (from the ladle) to the rear of the Garhapatya with the formula, “Here do I offer the ambrosia unto Vai┼Ыv─Бnara Agni, sv─Бh─БтАЭ or with the formula, “I offer the undecayed offering unto imperishableness, sv─Бh─Б.” The former option (of the formula) belongs to Baudh─Бyana, the latter to ┼Ъ─Бl─лki.1 manner. As for the praying with the Agnip─Бvam─Бn─л verses: Baudhayana says, one should pray to the Ahavaniya for a year in the normal manner; then (on the first anniversary) he should pray to the Garhapatya with the Agnip─Бvam─Бn─л verses, with the Gayatri verses and the Dvipad─Б verses, next day he should pray in the regular ┼Ъ─Бl─лki he should to the Ahavaniya for a year with the verses says, pray preceding and succeeding the Agnip─Бvam─Бn─л verses in the normal manner; then (on the first anniversary) he should pray to the Garhapatya with the Agnip─Бvam─Бn─л verses, the Gayatri verses and Dvip─Бda verses; next day he should pray in the regular manner. Aupamanyava holds the view (similar to that of ┼Ъaliki) and further adds that hereafter the Agnip─Бvam─Бni verses should be employed neither for the ├Дhavaniya nor for Gahapatya; they may be employed merely for scriptural study. ─А├▒j─лgavi says, one should pray with the Vyahс╣Ыtis and say. тАЬMay I be capable of maintaining you; let not my faith go astray.” As for the blessings: Baudh─Бyana says that one should first ask for blessings for himself, then for the sons, then for the progeny. ┼Ъ─Бl─лki says that one should first ask blessings for the sons, then for himself and then for the progeny. Aupamanyava says that in the absence of sons one should seek blessings for himself and the progeny. Aupamanyaviputra says that one may seek blessings in the evening as well as in the morning. XX.21 PINDAPITRYAJ┼ЗA In regard to the performance of the Pindapitс╣Ыyaj├▒a: Baudh─Бyana says - one should suspend the cord over the right shoulder from the beginning. Thus suspended, he should remain until the offering of oblations. He should suspend the cord over the left shoulder when he is going to offer the oblations. With the cord thus suspended, he should remain until the recitation of the verse addressed to Prajapati. Suspending the cord over the left shoulder, he should cross towards the north with the verse addressed to Praj─Бpati. He purifies only once the water (in the ladle) silently, sprinkles (the paddy) once, gives only once the call to the preparer of the oblation-material. So says Baudhayana. He should pour (the paddy) only once, pour into the vessel across the strainer, cook the rice in a vessel, pour clarified butter over it and take down towards the north. So says ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. Salikki As for the offering of the oblations: (the view expressed in) the s┼лtra (is that) of Baudhayana. says that one should not offer the middle oblation. The throwing of the corn-stirring stick should be the third offering. As for the spreading of the darbh-blades cut at one stroke : Baudh─Бyana says that having gone out of the fire-chamber, one should spread the darbha-blades cut at one stroke in the south-east and keep the fire-brand towards the south. S─Бl─лki says that one should spread towards that direction within the fire-chamber itself; he should not keep the fire-brand. As for the offering of the rice-balls: (the view expressed in) the s├╝tra (is that) of ┼Ъaliki. Baudh─Бyana says that one should offer the rice-balls so as to end towards the south in the order from the distant to the nearest (to the great grandfather, grandfather and father) through the span between the thumb and the forefinger. As for the ointment and collyrium, and the invoking of the mind:1 the former option is of Baudh─Бyana, the latter of ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. As for the disposing of the rice-balls: (the view expressed in) the s┼лtra (is that) of ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. Baudh─Бyana says that the rice-balls should lie here only; having been consumed by the Pitrs, they become their leavings. As for the consuming of the remaining (rice): the sacrificer himself should consume it, so says Baudh─Бyana. One should give it to a son or a pupil, so says ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. One should give it to his wife to eat; thereby he gets progeny; so says Aupamanyava. TRANSLATION 1369 XX.22 AGRAYANA As for the combination of performances in respect of the Agrayana: that there should be no combination of performances, is the view of the two teachers. Aupamanyava says that (instead of offering Sy─Бm─Бka in rainy season) one should offer (cooked Sy─Бm─Бka) for Soma (in the autumn) and then offer the other oblations. Thereby his oblations will have cooked rice as the foremost. Aupamanyaviputra says that (because of the transgression of offering ┼Ъy─Бm─Бka in the rainy season) offering it in a Soma-sacrifice should be supplementary. One should offer it between the cooked rice to Vi┼Ыve Devas and the cake on one potsherd (to Dy─Бv─Бpс╣Ыthivi). A├▒j─лgavi says that there should be three oblations. Three indeed are these worlds. (By offering these three oblations) one remains firm in these very three worlds. This purpose is served by (taking up) the Prastara of ┼Ъy─Бm─Бka. As for Ajy─Бni offerings (the view expressed in) the s┼лtra (is that) of Ajy─Бn─л Baudhayana. S─Бl─лki says that one should make the Ajy─Бni offerings before the Svistakс╣Ыt offering. As for the cooking of the Agrayana-oblations: one should cook in milk, says Baudh─Бyana. In water, says S─Бl─лki. As for the offering of a cake on one potsherd (to Dy─Бv─Бpс╣Ыthivi) in the Agrayaс╣Зa sacrifice: One should offer, says Baudhayana. One should not, says S─Бl─лki. As for the observation of pattern: Baudh─Бyana says that there should be fifteen S─Бmidheni verses, the ─Аjyabh─Бgas should be V─Бrtraghna, and offerings to the deities should be made with puronuv─Бky─Б-y─Бjy─Бs recited loudly. The sacrificer should do his duties. ┼а─Бl─лki says that there should be seventeen S─Бmidhen─лs, the ─Аjyabh─Бgas should be Vrdhanvant, the offerings to the deities should be made with the puronuv─Бky─Б-y─Бjy─Бs recited in a low tone. The sacrificer should do his duties. XX.23 AGNYUPASTH─АNA As for the exchange : Baudhayana says that one should proceed on journey after having exchanged himself with the Ahavaniya alone. Having gone on journey and having returned, one should again pray to ├Дhavaniya with all the formulas. ┼Ъ─Бl─лki says that one should proceed after having suitably exchanged himself with all the fires. Having gone on journey and having returned, he should again pray to each of the fires with all the formulas. As for one who has set out on a journey without praying: whenever he so recalls, he should pray to Agni beyond sight with the usual formulas; so says Baudh─Бyana. If he does not recall, having gone on journey and having returned, he S─Бl─лki. should pray with the usual formulas; so says As for the offering pertaining to the journey: Baudh─Бyana says that one The sacrificer however should not follow them with the formulas from the Yajam─Бna K─Бс╣Зс╕Нa. XX.24 As for the injunction that one should keep down the Agnihotra with the Vy─Бhс╣Ыtis bhur bhuvaс╕е suvaс╕е: one should do similarly at the conclusion of each year; so says ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. Baudhayana says that one should keep it down at the expiry of one year from the night on which he may keep it down first. He should not do so after that. Aupamanyava says that by so doing one would ascend the year. He should keep it down on the night preceding the completion of the year from the night on which he first put it down. Thereafter he should not do so. As for the injunction that one going to start the practice of performing the Full-moon and New-moon sacrifices should place (within the altar) the oblations with the Vy─Бhс╣Ыtis: One should do so at the commencement of each year: (this view expressed in) the s┼лtra (is that) of ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. Baudh─Бyana says that one should place them similarly at the expiry of one year from the full-moon on which he first placed them. He should not do so afterwards. Aupamanyava says that thereby one’s year becomes ascended. He should thus place them on the full-moon day preceding the completion of the year from that full-moon day on which he first placed them. He should not do so afterwards. Baudh─Бyana says that towards the east and towards the north one should trace from outside. As for the carrying away of earth: (the view expressed in) the s┼лtra (is that) of S─Бl─лki. Baudh─Бyana says that one should seat the Agnidhra at the Uttaravedi and then carry the earth. (The Agnidhara himself) should carry the earth from the very spot (towards the Uttaravedi); so says Aupamanyava. As for the measurement of the Uttaravedi : (the view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of S─Бl─лki. Baudh─Бyana says that one should measure with the pin in the case of the altar equal to a chariot. In that case there is no Uttaravedi. The tracing of the hole for the sacrificial post is already explained. As for the accomplishment of the Uttaravedi : (the view expressed in) the s├╝tra (is that) of Baudh─Бyana. One should carve out the Uttaran─Бbhi on the preceding day; so says ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. As for the injunction that the Agnidhra follows defacing by means of the wooden sword the Hotr’s foot-prints: (The view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. Baudh─Бyana says that one should go on pushing the dust from one foot-print to the other, and scatter that dust to the north of Uttaran─Бbhi. As for the sprinkling of the Uttaravedi : (The view expressed in) the s┼лtra (is that) of ┼Ъaliki.1 Baudh─Бyana says that one should sprinkle it as per direction mentioned in the formula and ending towards that quarter (starting from the centre). As for the pouring down of the remaining water: One should pour down over the southern shoulder of the altar; so says Baudh─Бyana. Over the southern shoulder of the Uttaravedi; says ┼Ъ─Бliki. One should pour down over the southern shoulder in the case of the altar equal to a chariot; so says Aupamanyava. 2 As for the pouring out of clarified butter over the Uttaravedi : (The view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of Baudh─Бyana. One should pour out in the opposite directions, so says S─Бl─лki. While pouring out transversely, one should make an offering in the centre and continue the pouring upto the northern shoulder; so says Aupamanyava. As for the keeping down of the faggot (upon the Uttaravedi): (The view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of Baudhayana. One should keep down the faggot silently; so says ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. 1. 2. That is to say, each sprinkling made in the relevant quarter should end towards the east. рееCHAPTER- XXI CATURMASYAS XXI.1 Now we shall explain the Caturm─Бsyas. Baudhayana says that the Caturm─Бsyas should be performed throughout one’s life; they should be joined to each other. One should however observe the vow (of celibacy) in respect of those to be performed in the first year. ┼Ъ─Бliki says that the Caturmasyas are restricted only to a (single) year. The vow of celibacy pertains (of course to that year alone). Aupamanyava says that (one should observe the vow of celibacy) during the days of performance. XXI.8] TRANSLATION 1407 As for the offering pertaining to the sacrificial post: The former option is of Baudh─Бyana; the latter of ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. As for the procurement of pieces of cloth: (One should procure) eight, says Baudh─Бyana. Seven, says ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. As for the procurement of skins of black antelope: (One should procure) five, says Baudh─Бyana. Six, says S─Бl─лki. As for the procurement of a horn of black antelope: It should have three curves, says Baudh─Бyana. Five, says Saliki. It should be whole, says Aupamanyava. As for the container of Vrata-milk: It should be of bronze, says Baudhayana. It should be a wooden goblet, says ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. As for the performance of the Pravargya-rite: Baudh─Бyana says that one should not perform in the first Soma-sacrifice. Thereby he becomes capable of performing a subsequent Soma-sacrifice. One should not at all go in for the Pravargya, says ┼Ъ─Бliki. XXI.8 As for reaching the water-place: Baudhayana says that one should turn by the right and then proceed to the water-place. From there he should return by the left. S─Бl─лki says that one should turn by the left and then proceed to the water-place. From there he should return by the right. As for the injunction that one moistens with water the hair near the right ear of the sacrificer facing the east : (The view expressed in) the s┼лtra (is that) of Baudh─Бyana. ┼Ъ─Бl─лki says that one should perform with formulas the rites pertaining to the hair near both the ears. As for the anointing: (The view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. Baudhayana says that the Adhvaryu should take the ointment with the formula, “Thou art the milk of great (cows),” and anoint with the formula, “Thou art the giver of vigour, grant me vigour.” As for applying collyrium to the eyes: (The view expressed in) the s├╗tra (is that) of ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. (Or) five times the southern one and five times the northern one : The former view is of Baudhayana, the latter of ┼а─Бl─лki. [XXI.8 XXI.8] TRANSLATION 1409 He should sprinkle water upon them and toss up towards the north. ┼Ъ─Бl─лki says that, following the injunction-one purifies with two, one purifies with three, one should purify separately with twentyone bunches, sprinkle water upon them and toss up towards the north. Aupamanyava says that one should purify the sacrificer at his vital breath with all bunches together, with the combined formulas, “May the lord of cognition purify thee, may the lord of speech purify thee, may god Savitс╣Ы purify thee with the strainer without a crevice, by means of the rays of the shining sun.” He should make the sacrificer recite the formula divinitywise, sprinkle water upon them, and toss up towards the north. As for the injunction-having held him by his left palm: by the right palm-so is it said (elsewhere): The first alternative is prescribed by Baudhayana; the second by ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. As for the injunction - after having led him along the front of the Ahavaniya : along the rear-is said (elsewhere) : The first alternative is prescribed by ┼Ъ─Бl─лki; the second by Baudh─Бyana. As for the escorting of the sacrificer’s wife: (The view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. Baudh─Бyana says that one should purify her who is already clean, escort her with the entire verse (praitu brahma┼Жas patn─л …) recited by her, and seat her to the rear of the Garhapatya. As for the initiation of the sacrificer’s wife: (The view expressed in) the s┼лtra (is that) of the two teachers. Aupamanyava says that one should initiate her at the Pr─Бyaс╣З─лye┼Яti at the end of the call to the preparer of oblation-material. As for the injunction that the Adhvaryu does not administer vow to the sacrificer: (The view expessed in) the sutra (is that) of ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. Baudh─Бyana says that in the procedure of a Soma-sacrifice the sacrificer’s duty prescribed in the Pauroс╕Н─Б┼Эika K─Бс╣Зс╕Нa (of the K─Бс╣Зс╕Н─Бnukrama) recurs except “the regaining of the sacrifice.“l As for the injunction that (the Pratiprasth─Бtс╣Ы) does not gird the sacrificer’s wife: (The view expressed in) the s┼лtra (is that) of S─Бl─лki. Baudh─Бyana says that one should gird her at the Dikс╣гaс╣Зiye┼Яti with the formulas prescribed for the Adhvaryu and the sacrificer and ungird her at the conclusion of the Isti. Optionally he may gird at each Isti (in the Soma-sacrifice) hereafter with the formulas prescribed in the Pauroс╕Н─Бsika K─Бс╣Зс╕Нa. As for the swelling of the Dhruva : Baudh─Бyana says that both the Adhvaryu and the sacrificer should swell the Dhruv─Б. S─Бl─лki says that the Adhvaryu alone should swell the Dhruv─Б and then offer the Dikс╣г─Бhutis. 1. cf. As for the touching together of the black and white parts of the skin: Baudh─Бyana says that the thumb should be on the white part and the forefinger on the black one. In this way he should touch together the white and black parts. S─Бl─лki says that one should touch together the joint with the flat palm of his hand. Tying of the knot (of the sacrificer’s girdle) is already explained. (The sacrificer) should dig up the border of the altar silently. (The Adhvaryu) should silently touch the border of his hair. As for the contingency, namely, the consuming of milk (by the sacrificer) while on journey: One should churn out fire, spread out fires, and consume, says Baudh─Бyana. One should keep the kindling woods to the north, put an enclosure to the south, and consume, says S─Бl─лki. As for the contingency - if the sacrificer meets on the way with waters which cannot be avoided by going circuitously: (The view expressed in) the s┼лtra (is that) of ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. Baudh─Бyana says-when he meets with waters which cannot be avoided by going circuitously, he should murmur the formula, dar apo ap─Бm nap─Бd ya urmir bhavisya indriy─Бv─Бn madintamas t─Бn vo gс╣Ыhс╣З─Бmi. He should take up three clods of earth. He should keep down one of them with the formula, taс╣Б vo m─Бvakramiс╣гam. Crushing it, he should pass across with the formula, acchinnaс╣Б tantum… He should keep down the last one on the border of water with the formula, pс╣Ыthivy─Б anu geс╣гam. He may either pass through water or cross (in a boat). “He passes beyond having formed a bridge as it were,” so says the Brahmaс╣Зa. XXI.11 As for the injunction - on the red skin : (The view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of Baudh─Бyana. It may even be non-red, says ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. As regards the piece of gold for taking up the shoots of Soma: One should procure, says Baudh─Бyana. One may not, says S─Бl─лki. As for the formal occupation of the sacrificial place: (The view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of the two teachers. Aupamanyava says that the Adhvaryu should formally occupy the sacrificial place before the sacred fires have been spread into three fire places. It is indeed said, “This entire (earth) is the altar.” The pouring out of the oblation for the Prayaniye╚Щti is explained. As for the cooking (of the rice for) the Pr─Бyaс╣З─лye╚Щti: One should cook in milk, says Baudhayana. In water, says ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. As for the placing of (the rice for) the Pr─Бyaс╣З─лye╚Щti: One should place with the Saddhotr-formulas, says Baudh─Бyana. Silently, says S─Бl─лki. As for the offering (of rice) in the Prayaniyesti: One should recite the relevant mantras in a low voice, says Baudh─Бyana. Loudly, says ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. As for the gazing at the sun : One should make the sacrificer gaze at the sun across a piece of gold, says Baudh─Бyana. Not across (a piece of gold), says ┼Ъ─Бl─лki.
Namely, the carrying forth of the fires themselves.
3. Namely, consigning the fires into kindling woods.

At the spot fixed for the Uparava- holes, says ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. As for following in the steps of the Soma-purchasing cow: One should follow and mark the print of the right foreleg of the cow when she has crossed beyond the spot for the Pс╣Ыс╣гс╣нhy─Б, says Baudh─Бyana. One should mark any (foot-print) after she has crossed beyond the great altar, says ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. As for the tracing around of the foot-print of the Soma-purchasing cow: (The view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of ┼Ъ─Бliki. Baudh─Бyana says that one should trace around the foot-print by means of the wooden sword and the horn of black antelope. The horn should be innermost. XXI.12 As for the pouring down of the pot full of water: One should pour by the right, says Baudhayana. As may be suitable, says ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. While reciting this verse, one should measure Soma five times, says ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. As for the bargaining of Soma: (The view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of Baudh─Бyana. One should simply say, “I shall purchase thee for a cow, says ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. As for the seizing of she-goat: (The view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of Baudh─Бyana. Baudh─Бyana. As may be suitable, says ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. As for waiting upon king Soma: Baudhayana says that one should wait upon king Soma with paddy, kindling woods and the wooden stool. ┼Ъ─Бl─лki says that one should wait upon king Soma with a male goat held by the ear, a fire-brand and the wooden stool. That male goat should be the one to be offered to Agni-Soma, red, hornless, uncastrated, bearded and fat. So is it said. XXI.13 As for the formal procuring of the sacrificial grass for the Atithye┼Я╚Ыi : One should employ the formulas beginning with that for taking up the sickle, says Baudh─Бyana. Beginning with that for preparing the cord, says S─Бl─лki. Beginning with that for piling up the bundles, says Aupamanyava. As for the pouring out (of paddy) for the Atithyesti: (The view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. Baudhayana says that one should unyoke both the oxen, fetch king Soma (into the Pragvaс╣Б┼Ыa hall) and then pour out paddy for the ─Аtithye┼Яti. As for honouring king Soma: (The view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of ┼Ъ─Бliki. Baudh─Бyana says that one should honour king Soma with the verse,1and also worship with the verse.1 As for the reception: One should formally receive the officiating priests as they arrive, says Baudh─Бyana. After having formally received king Soma, one should receive the priests, says S─Бl─лki. As for the guest-reception: A cake and a cow should be presented, says Baudh─Бyana. Only cake, says ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. As for taking portions of clarified butter: They should be taken in four spoonfuls or five spoonfuls, says Baudh─Бyana. In five spoonfuls, says ┼Ъ─Бliki. As for placing (the cake) for the Atithya-offering: One should place it with the Caturhotr-formulas, says Baudh─Бyana. Silently, says S─Бl─лki. As for the offering of the Atithya (cake): One should make the offering with mantras recited in a low voice, says Baudh─Бyana. Loudly, says ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. As for the carrying away of the dust dug out of the Uparavas : (The view expressed in) the s┼лtra (is that) of ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. Baudh─Бyana says that one should pour it down under the sacrificer’s feet, then carry it to the rubbish-heap and touch it. As for the sprinkling of the Uparavas: One should sprinkle each one thrice, says Baudh─Бyana. Once each, says S─Бl─лki. One should pour water in to each one and drop barley-grains; one should do so thrice with regard to each one, says Aupamanyava. One should perform each of these rites successively, says Aupamanyaviputra. As for the pouring down of the Dhiс╣гniya mounds: Baudh─Бyana says that one should pour down the Agnidhriya Dhiс╣гniya on the border of the Mah─Бvedi, and also the M─Бrj─Бl─лya mound on the border of the Mahavedi. In pouring down the Dhisniya mounds, one should accomplish the concluding towards the north. ┼Ъ─Бl─лki says that one should pour down the Agnidhriya mound within the Mah─Бvedi, and also the M─Бrj─Бl─лya mound within the Mah─Бvedi. In pouring down the Dhiс╣гniya mounds, one need not accomplish the concluding towards the north. As for the spreading of sacrificial grass within the Mah─Бvedi : (The view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. Baudh─Бyana says that three persons should spread towards the south, three towards the north, the seventh in the middle. Standing from the spot of the Pс╣Ыс╣гс╣нhy─Б, they should go on spreading towards the east. Aupamanyava says that they should go on spreading from east to west. As for the taking up and placing of the clarified butters for the Agniс╣гomiya sacrifice: (The view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of Baudh─Бyana. ┼а─Бl─лki says that one should take up clarified butters in the chamber of the sacrificer’s wife, and place on the mound. As for carrying forth (a part of the old Garhapatya to the new Garhapatya): (The view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of Baudh─Бyana. One need not pay heed to it, says S─Бl─лki. As for giving (to the sacrificer) half of the milk drawn from one udder (of the Vrata-cow): Baudh─Бyana says that having or not having carried forth the old Garhapatya fire, one should give half of the milk drawn from one udder. ┼а─Бl─лki says that one should not give half of the milk drawn from one udder (at this stage. That is to say, one should give at midday the entire quantity of milk derived from one udder). As for Vaisarjana offering: (The view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of Baudh─Бyana. One should not make four offerings each one of four spoonfuls, says ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. As for the carrying of Vasat─лvari waters following (the carrying forth of fire and Soma) 3: One should carry forth, says Baudh─Бyana. One should not, says ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. 3. As for the extractings of draughts from the Ukthya vessel at the third pressing: Baudhayana says that one should (separately) enter into the Sadas for the offerings of the draughts from the Ukthya vessel at the third pressing, of the ┼Юoс╕Нa┼Ыin draught, at the nocturnal rounds and at the Rathantara Samdhi. ┼Ъ─Бl─лki says that these offerings are indeed the extension of the third pressing. As for the offering in a line : (The view expressed in) the s├╗tra (is that) of Baudhayana. One should make an offering in a line from the draught itself, says ┼Ъ─Бliki. As3 for the consuming back of the goblets of the Hotrakas by the Adhvaryu or the Pratiprasth─Бtс╣Ы: One should consume, says Baudhayana. One should not, says ┼Ъ─Бl─лki.
3(As for the injunction that the Adhvaryu should consume the Hotraka’s goblet) with the formula, “I place speech into speech” or silently: The former alternative is of Baudh─Бyana, the latter of ┼Ъ─Бl─лki.
As for touching oneself back : (The view expressed in) the s┼лtra (is that) of ┼Ъ─Бliki. Baudh─Бyana says that one should touch himself after consuming (the goblet).
As for the taking of the draught for Indra-Agni: (The view expressed in) the s┼лtra (is that) of the two teachers. Dirghavatsya says that one should take it in the principal cup.5
As for shaking of the N─Бr─Б┼Ыaс╣Бsa goblets: (The Camas─Бdhvaryus) should shake them, says Baudhayana. They should not, says S─Бl─лki. They should not even lift them up, says Aupamanyava.

As for the taking of the Dadhigharma: (The view expressed in) the s┼лtra (is that) of Baudh─Бyana. One should take it in the Agnidhra chamber, says S─Бl─лki. One should enclose the chamber, recite ┼Ъanti-formulas on both sides and take it in the Agnidhra chamber itself; says Aupamanyava.
As for the offering of the Dadhigharma : One should offer with the formulas recited in a low voice, says Baudh─Бyana. Recited loudly, says ┼Ъ─Бl─лki.
As for the consuming of the Dadhigharma : (The view expressed in) the s┼лtra (is that) of ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. Baudh─Бyana says that the others (that is, the priests) should consume merely by smelling; the sacrificer alone should consume with the formula1 prescribed in the Aranyaka.
As for leading the cows as Dakс╣гin─Бs: (The view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of ┼Ъaliki. Baudhayana says that one should lead only one cow along the southern path; other cows may proceed conveniently.
As for the movement (of the priests) : After the Dakс╣гiс╣З─Б-cows have been led, they may move as required, so says Baudh─Бyana. The Adhvaryu should not go to the west before the conclusion of the Soma-offering; so says S─Бl─лki.
As for the throwing away of the horn of black antelope: (The view expressed in) the s┼лtra (is that) of Baudhayana. One should throw away the horn after the Dakс╣гina-cows have been led; so says ┼Ъ─Бl─лki.
As for the dialogue in regard to one belonging to the Atrigotra: (The view expressed in) the s┼лtra (is that) of ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. Baudh─Бyana says that one enquires thrice without intervention, “Who is here that belongs to the Atrigotra, who is here that belongs to the Atrigotra?тАЭ
XXI.22
As for the giving of Dakс╣гi┼Ж─Б-cows: Baudh─Бyana says that one should give them to the high priests; they need not be led towards the Hotrakas. ┼а─Бl─лki says that they need not be led towards the Hotrakas. One should also not give to the Sadasya; his name is not mentioned.
As for the offering of the two Marutvatiya draughts: Baudh─Бyana says that the offering which is made by the Adhvaryu should be attended by the Vasat-and the second Vaс╣гat-utterance; the other one should not be attended by the second Vaс╣гat- utterance. ┼Ъ─Бl─лki says that both should not be attended by the second Va╚Щat- utterance. Aupamanyava says that both the offerings should be attended by the second Vasat-utterance (also).

As for the taking of the third Marutvatiya draught: (The view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of two teachers. Dirghavatsya says that one should take it in the principal cup.
As for the shaking of the N─Бr─Б┼Ыamsa goblets: They should shake, says Baudhayana. They should not shake, says S─Бliki. They should even not lift them up, says Aupamanyava.
As for the reciting or non-reciting of formulas in respect of (cooking the rice for) Soma: It should be accompanied by formulas, says Baudh─Бyana. It should be prepared silently, says ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. The rice for Soma should be accompanied by formulas; the cake on one potsherd (for Varuna) should be prepared silently, says Aupamanyava.
As for the pressing (of Soma) for the third pressing: (The view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of Baudh─Бyana. One should say, “In that it is swollen (with water) thereby it is provided with shoots,” says
┼Ъ─Бl─лki.
As for the taking of the draught for Aditya: (The view expressed in) the s┼лtra (is that) of ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. Baudhayana says that one should take it prior to the pressing; he should silently pour into it curds prepared out of milk curdled when hot.
As for striking upwards the Aditya cup (by means of the Up─Бс╣Б┼Ыusavana stone): One should strike at each half verse, says Baudh─Бyana. At each verse, says ┼Ъ─Бl─лki.
As for the mixing of the draught for Mitra-Varuna with milk and pouring warm milk into it: (The view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. Baudh─Бyana says that one should mix the draught for Mitra-Varu┼Жa with milk and pour warm milk into it.
As for the injunction that the Adhvaryu makes the sacrificer recite the relevant formula when the chanting of the ninth verse has been introduced: (The view expressed in) the s┼лtra (is that) of Baudh─Бyana. ┼Ъ─Бl─лki says that one should make him recite the relevant formula when the chanting of any verse is introduced.
As for the gratification of the Hotrakas’ functions: (The view expressed in) the s┼лtra (is that) of ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. Baudh─Бyana says that one should gratify the function at each pressing. Aupamanyava says that one should gratify five in the morning pressing, six in the midday-pressing and seven in the third pressing.

XXI.23
As for the taking and placing of the draught for Savitr: (The view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of Baudhayana. S─Бl─лki says that one should take it with the formula with the word justa joined to it, wipe it around and place.
As for the injunction that the Adhvaryu gives the response with the mada-part joined on one side: (The view expressed in) the s┼лtra (is that) of Baudh─Бyana. S─Бl─лki says that one should respond as mad─Б moda iva.
As for the shaking of the N─Бr─Б┼Ыaс╣Б┼Ыa goblets They should shake, says Baudhayana. they should not, says S─Бl─лki. They should not even lift them up, says Aupamanyava.
As for the offering of the cooked rice to Soma: One should offer with the formulas recited in a low voice, says Baudh─Бyana. Recited loudly, says ┼а─Бl─лki.
As for the offering of clarified butter on both sides of the offering (of cooked rice) to Soma: Baudhayana says that whether Agni-Viс╣г┼Жu are addressed combinedly or separately in the y─Бjy─Бs, the y─Бjy─Бs should be recited in a low voice. ┼Ъ─Бl─лki says that if the deities are addressed together, the y─Бjy─Бs should be recited in a low voice; if they are addressed (in the two y─Бjy─Бs) separately, they should be recited loudly.
As for the spreading of fires on the Dhiс╣гс╣Зiya mounds at the third pressing : (The view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of S─Бl─лki.2 Baudhayana says that before or after the offering of cooked rice to Soma, one should spread fire-brands on the Dhi┼Яniyas four times.
As for the mixing of the P─Бtn─лvata draught: (The view expressed in) the s┼лtra (is that) of Baudh─Бyana. ┼Ъ─Бl─лki says that one should mix the Patnivata either with curds or milk. Aupamanyava says that one should mix the P─Бtnivata with clarified butter which remained after spreading clarified butter in a line over the Dhisniyas.
As for escorting the sacrificer’s wife: (The view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of Baudh─Бyana. She should remain here until she listens to the Hoty reciting the verse apo hi с╣гс╣нh─Б… (in the Vai┼Ыvadeva ┼Ъ─Бstra).
As for the injunction that (the Adhvaryu) responds to the Sastra with the mada- part on both sides: (The view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of Baudhayana. One should respond with moda moda iva, says ┼Ъal─лki.
As for the dropping of the Dhruva vessel: (The view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of Baudhayana. The entire formula3 should be employed for dropping down.

TRANSLATION
1449
As for the laying of the enclosing sticks for (the offering of Amikс╣г─Б to) Mitra- Varuna: (The view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of ┼Ъ─Бliki. One should tear the eastern door-posts of the Sadas or the Havirdh─Бna and use the splinters as the enclosing sticks for the offering to Mitra-Varuna, says Baudhayana.
As for the Udavas─Бn─лyeс╣гс╣нi (The view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of Baudh─Бyana. One should offer Purс╣Зahuti instead of the Udavas─Бniye┼Яti, says ┼Ъ─Бliki.
As for giving away Dakс╣гi┼Ж─Б : (The view expressed in) the s┼лtra (is that) of Baudhayana. One should not give any thing which is not determined by one’s desire, says
┼а─Бl─лki.
As for the offering of the Devika-oblations: (The view expressed in) the sutra (is that) of Aupamanyav├пputra. Three oblations shoud follow the Pasupuroс╕Н─Б┼Ыa of the Anubandhya sacrifice; three of the Udavas─Бn─лya, says Baudh─Бyana. All should follow the Pasupuroс╕Нa┼Ыa of Anubandhya sacrifice, says ┼Ъ─Бl─лki. One should offer clarified butter to Devik─Бs, says ─А├▒j─лgavi.
As for returning home together with the fires: One should return together with the lasting fires, says Baudh─Бyana. Having consigned them into kindling woods, says
┼Ъ─Бl─лki.
As for the separate offering of the two Agnihotras: One should make separate offerings, says Baudh─Бyana. One should not, says
┼Ъ─Бl─лki.
